website_summaries.verdict: Despite a few concerns, it's an attractive powerhouse that moves an impressive amount of air and has lots of nice features.
pros: Combines quiet operation and powerful air movement with convenient features: remote control, adjustable stand, and 5 strong blades engineered to move air in all directions
cons: Complaints of rust developing on the fan blade enclosure grills and less-than-attentive customer service have been reported

customer_reviews.title: Grills Rust Quickly
customer_reviews.text: As many have noted, the grills rust quickly and quite badly. This is a shame for an otherwise excellent product. Replacement grills are hard to find, but after much searching, I found a source on the Internet. The cost to replace the grills is a bit high, but much less than replacing the entire fan. I suggest spray painting the new grills with a metallic colored rust preventative paint before using them.
customer_reviews.author: RBIII

customer_reviews.title: Grill Replacement
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this fan for three (3) years and have been very pleased with its features: solid, stable base, extremely quiet operation, multi-functional features (speed, oscillation, etc.), and consistent, reliable operation. My primary complaint is that the grill has become extremely rusted (despite regular maintenance) and I haven't been able to locate a replacement. Based on similar complaints, this is a defect that should be remedied by the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Lael B. Stabler

customer_reviews.title: Bought this fan 2 1/2 years ago. I do ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this fan 2 1/2 years ago. I do not live near the beach, yet the fan grill is rusted and the manufacturer will not stand behind it's product. Considering the price, this is very disappointing. I definitely would not buy from them again, at least anything expensive that I wanted to last.
customer_reviews.author: Daria Flores

customer_reviews.title: Great fan - Crappy customer support
customer_reviews.text: Really like the fan itself. Incredibly quiet and just perfect for next to a bike trainer. But - wow - what a disappointing service experience. The first remote had issues right out of the box. It wouldn’t turn the fan on/off, but it would boost the speed once it was on. Called Rowenta. The replacement remote was in Europe and would take 3-4 weeks. That new remote arrived yesterday. It’s an entirely different remote with only basic on/off functionality. Bottom line - we now need two remotes. The “new” one to turn it on & off, the “other one” to utilize the fan’s other functions. Not exactly ideal and incredibly disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: and now looks horrible. If you buy this fan take time to ...
customer_reviews.text: The fan works very well, moves air and is very quiet. BUT-- the wire metal fan protector rusts. Mine started rusting within three months of purchase, and now looks horrible. If you buy this fan take time to put some rustoleum or other protection on the wire before using it.
customer_reviews.author: Kailand

customer_reviews.title: Obvious Planned Obsolescence
customer_reviews.text: Hey Rowenta, your planned obsolescence is showing. I purchased this fan just under 3 years ago, and the cheap flimsy plastic that is supposed to hold the entire base of the fan to the stand was cracked and bent/warped. The one plastic screw you so generously provided to hold the weight of the entire fan onto this cheap plastic also helped lead to the destruction of the plastic. Who would've thought grade F plastic and one crappy screw couldn't hold on to the base? Anyways, you can scam someone else. I'm no longer purchasing Rowenta products.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Tabatabai

customer_reviews.title: The fan itself is weak even on turbo and the ...
customer_reviews.text: The fan itself is weak even on turbo and the stand it sits on does not support the weight of the fan. and ithe fan itself keeps slipping down. I have tried tightening it and it still slips down. NOT worth the price. I would definitively say, DO NOT BUY THIS FAN!!
customer_reviews.author: Dee62

customer_reviews.title: Rusted!
customer_reviews.text: I probably should not have assumed it could be used on my covered patio in Florida, but I figured it would at least last a little while - WRONG! The fan works very well, but the wire grate rusted like you wouldn't believe within a few weeks. I cleaned scraped and spray painted and it rusted through again - the ugliest sight you ever saw. For the price you would think the wire grate would have been a better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Patty1301

customer_reviews.title: I hate this thing!! DO NOT BUY!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am so ready to just throw this stupid fan off the top of my house out blow it up for 4th of July with some half sticks!! I did NOT get a remote!! What did I get?? A bunch of parts and papers with pictures on it!! I paid $125 for this garbage that you have to put all together when they could have shipped the item half put together in 2 pieces, not 20 with a bunch of pictures for instructions!!! There's a lot of plastic and stand is not secure.. Don't buy this thing!!! Save yourself the headaches!
customer_reviews.author: Tenyrsgone

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Super silent which is the main reason I ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Super silent which is the main reason I purchased this fan. After less than a year of use the back screw pulled away from the plastic under normal use. Seems like a design defect as the top of this fan is heavy and puts weight down to the bottom towards the back where the screw sits. Now I can no longer raise the fan without worry it will topple over under higher speeds since the screw no longer can hold the fan in place. Checking into a warranty since its been close to a year next month, hopefully I can get this fix/replaced. Will update review once I see how warranty goes.
customer_reviews.author: Ferdinand Ferrao III

customer_reviews.title: The rear of the motor housing vibrates and makes a horrible noise. I could have bought a $20 fan ...
customer_reviews.text: No way to contact customer service and just at one year this fan has become obsessively loud on low. It used to be almost dead silent but that is no longer the case. The rear of the motor housing vibrates and makes a horrible noise. I could have bought a $20 fan from WalMart that woul have lasted 10 years. This is not a good purchase. It has not ever been moved or used on oscillating. Still in the same place by my bed since it was purchased and assembled.
customer_reviews.author: Sman

customer_reviews.title: Loved the fan at first
customer_reviews.text: Loved the fan at first, it was nice and quiet, but it appears the motor died on it after 3 years of use. For an item that expensive, I expect it to last longer than that. Waiting to see if Rowenta will stand behind their product and fix, but not the happy camper I was at first. Edit: And my response from Rowenta regarding my fan was that I could "send my iron in for repair" on my dime. Not sure they even read original inquiry. Will not be buying any more Rowenta products. Too expensive for the short life the fan lasted. Even the cheapest fans I've bought over the years have never failed like this one has.
customer_reviews.author: 88keys

customer_reviews.title: Best Fan I’ve Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this fan 3 years ago for my basement which was very humid. I have moved 3 times since and have been nothing less than pleased with this product. I didn’t plan on leaving a review but when I saw all of these awful reviews years later I felt obligated to share my positive feedback. This product is powerful, quiet, and durable. I have had ZERO issues with rust. I have relocated this fan around various rooms in my home to circulate cool air when necessary(especially when entertaining). Best fan I’ve ever owned and will be purchasing another one this summer.
customer_reviews.author: VILLA

customer_reviews.title: Silent fan but with major structural flaw
customer_reviews.text: Fan is silent when put it silent mode and overall it's silent in normal modes as well. But this fan has major structural flaw as others have pointed out. My fan broke just below switches within a year. From the beginning I knew the construction of this fan was not so great so I kept at one place and operated by remote. But within a year top part of the fan wobbling significantly and might fall off when running.
customer_reviews.author: GatorBoy

customer_reviews.title: How does this have such good reviews?
customer_reviews.text: I have another fan in my house we got on Aamazon that was about 30$ cheaper that has far better function and is FAR more stable. The pole wobbles where the couple locks down the mounting rod. The noise is fairly quiet but also unstable.. almost like it pulses which is annoying. It feels very cheap overall. I am baffled at how this got such high reviews. My cheaper fan has small in increment fan speed settings from 1 to 25.. this basically has 5 speeds. It's just an "OK" fan.. nothing special about it and it should be about half the price they ask for it.
customer_reviews.author: BG

customer_reviews.title: Rowenta  Turbo Fan broke!
customer_reviews.text: After 3 days of use Two(2) of the four(4) mini screws attaching the bottom plate to the down rod of the fan broke off and fan toppled to floor. It missed hitting me by about 6 inches. Contacted Rowena--directed by them to repackage & return and they would send a return label. Still waiting for label. In the interim much difficulty removing cover to fan "housing". Looking for a plastic spudger as suggested in another review. Bottom line. Fan worked beautifully; so quiet ; too bad that base is so poorly constructed!! Fan is top heavy so it needs a more stable and secure base!!
customer_reviews.author: Erma

customer_reviews.title: Expensive for what it, but worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: So...$85 for an upright fan seems high, however, I cannot tell you right now that you will not regret this purchase. It took <10 mins to put it together, get the remote ready to go, and the fan fired up. It has multiple modes: 1. Silent (no lights, and somewhat slow, but definitely pushes out a good amount of air) 2. Slow, Medium, High (all standard) 3. Turbo Boost (FAST and while louder, is not "loud" 4. 140 Degrees of oscillation, or zero if you want We use a combination of all these, almost daily as we live near Hades. I highly recommended this fan to anyone and everyone! Buy immediately!
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit.
customer_reviews.text: The fan is not as powerful as stated, but it will get the job done. I use it to help cool a bedroom down that tends to be the hottest room in the house as it is the last room the AC gets too. I use it in conjunction with the AC and and smaller van and have no issues. I haven't tried the remote control as I never have gotten around to buying a battery for it. As for assembling, once I figured out attaching the rod, it was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Preston

customer_reviews.title: Proceed with caution.
customer_reviews.text: For the cost, this should still be working. It's been approx 3 years and only a year warranty. I have another fan upstairs, working with no issue. It started making a very high pitched squeal so I turned off, unplugged. Letting it cool, but it is probably toast. No one makes anything that lasts anyone, so sad.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal K.

customer_reviews.title: QUIET AND POWERFUL!
customer_reviews.text: I researched a lot of fans looking for QUIET but adequate air flow for my bedroom. Found it in this Rowenta! It is completely silent on its lowest setting and still has enough air that I don’t need a higher setting. The higher settings have air flow noise and blows my hair back! BEST FAN EVER! I did need a little help putting it together but not much. Remote is handy and responsive. Don’t hesitate. I did the research for ya lol!
customer_reviews.author: WineLady

customer_reviews.title: Fan gets an A, packaging gets a C-
customer_reviews.text: The fan is the quietest fan of this type I've ever owned, and it moves air! (other fans are really quiet when turned off...). Lots of options, very useful. However, it seems the manufacturer and Amazon were in competition for 'most profligate and useless cardboard packaging'. The manufacturer double-boxed the fan, but Amazon decided they needed their logo involved, so they put this very heavy double-boxed fan in a larger box with a couple of pieces of crumpled paper (useless)...the heavier box bounced around inside the Amazon box and ripped through it in a couple of places. Then, once you start unpacking the actual fan, there's dozens of smaller cardboard pieces...just seems extremely wasteful.
customer_reviews.author: Whereupon

customer_reviews.title: Really wanted it to work :{
customer_reviews.text: The VU5551 fan arrived with a broken hub, which is the threaded plastic piece that holds the grills and fan blade. It's part of the motor assembly and without it, there is no fan. I tried looking for the part on the Rowenta website, but they seem to focus more on irons than anything else and was not able to find any parts. Too bad, I really wanted it to work.Sending it back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: ToeKnee

customer_reviews.title: 1 time out 6 a good one.
customer_reviews.text: A risky item to order. I have one solid one after two purchases, returned one. Needed a second one. Two tries both wobbled and returned both. i went through another distributor, all three wobbled. And the poles are somewhat floppy. Six years ago I purchased a table top version and it has held up beautifully. For this reason I thought to try the standing version. The quality lacks in comparison. My favorite of all fans which i've had for over 10 years is the no-longer available AllAir metal fan. Would I buy this product again? When needed I'd opt for the table fan instead. The fan speeds are great and the noise level acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: nbeacon

customer_reviews.title: It looks really nice, it definitely works well but it's not nearly ...
customer_reviews.text: Not "silent" at all. The motor hums, the oscillation buzzes, the entire thing vibrates the floor. It looks really nice, it definitely works well but it's not nearly as "turbo silent" as I thought it would be. It's got about average power. Kenmore makes great fans that remotely control the oscillation, but not this. $125 out the door for this thing??? It's made well though, I guess, in China. The most silent fan I have is the Vornado 660. That's a silent fan. I call it: "sleep mode". Very quiet low setting. But... no remote and no oscillation on the 660. The remote control is key. This Rowenta fan is over-priced. The best fans: Kenmore and Vornado.
customer_reviews.author: Carson

customer_reviews.title: just like that. Looks like it's not usable any more
customer_reviews.text: The pivoting head, including the motor, is held to the base with 3 plastic fasteners, not screws. I pushed on it and one of them snapped, just like that. Looks like it's not usable any more. Oh wait, I could use Duct tape! Fantastic ghetto look for you...
customer_reviews.author: Mama523

customer_reviews.title: BAD... NOT STRONG!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible! For the price that I paid it doesn't work. You can buy something cheap ($50) and has the same result, at least you'll spend less money. I never use the remote control, the noise I don't care if the fan is not work well, and assembly doesn't matter be easy if the fan is bad. Overall I just can give it 1 star (I should give it ZERO), because I expected a good fan. SO DISAPPOINTED. Spend lot of money in a bad fan, thinking that was good. I bought it after read the reviews. It's probably fake reviews. Please don't buy it! Buy a cheap one, instead!
customer_reviews.author: Frances Reuther

customer_reviews.title: Price isn’t always quality
customer_reviews.text: Well it looks pretty, after trying to assemble with only pictures, which was fun. I had to look up the video online since I’m a fan building novice. Worked great the first night. Second night it developed a noise, I would guess as the upper part of the fan isn’t completely stable it allows for some error in rotation causing a sort of fan murmur. I broke the top of the fan back down, tightened all of the components possible to reduce the noise. Worked for about another 20 minutes before starting again. I would expect this if I’d bought the fan from Walmart, but not a $100+ fan.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin

customer_reviews.title: For that price I would have expected better quality
customer_reviews.text: Given the label of "German" product of Rowentha, this fan is of rather poor quality. The base is very heavy, but the upper part made of light plastic. Each time I lift the fan, I am afraid of breaking it in the middle. I would have expected a better product construction from Rowentha (or what used to be Rowentha when I grew up in Europe...). The lowest mode is indeed very very quiet, but it produces a very gentle flow of air only. Already after 1 month of using it the ventilator blade starts being out of balance ... Not worth a Rowentha label!
customer_reviews.author: Ulifan

customer_reviews.title: It's crazy quiet
customer_reviews.text: This fan is incredibly quiet. I am shocked. Assembly is easy BUT don't be like me - the plastic bit you have to pull off to get the fan cover on is a reverse thread and says as much on the top of it. It comes off very easily - you don't pull it off. The remote could come with AAA batteries and save us all the hassle -honestly - charge me $5.00 more and do that. I am immediately in love with this fan.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca E. Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Great fan, super quiet!!!
customer_reviews.text: This fan is EXTREMELY QUIET, JUST AS THEY ADVERTISED IT!!! It seems to be made very well (it's designed in Germany and manufactured in China) it is also very good looking, I think. I know it is A LOT more expensive than some of the cheap mostly plastic ones out there, but I think this is one that's worth it!!! My brother has 2 of them, one in the living room so he can hear the tv well, and one in his bedroom, so he can sleep peacefully. He loved the first one he had so much he ordered the second one soon after!!! I have the table top model in my wife's bedroom, and she loves it too!!!
customer_reviews.author: These mugs suck!!!!

customer_reviews.title: Happy so far.
customer_reviews.text: My main reason for trying this oscillating fan is because I have previously bought probably a dozen oscillating fans in the past, and the oscillating part always breaks and cannot be repaired, so I decided to give this one a try. So far I am happy. Assembly was easy enough, fan seems to be of quality construction and is very quiet. Now, we will just see how long the oscillating feature continues to work. I will post an update later on.
customer_reviews.author: W. Proctor

customer_reviews.title: Chrome plating has failed and grill has rusted after two years.
customer_reviews.text: Nice quiet fan, BUT after two years, the chrome plating on the grill is pitting off and the inside of the grill is all rusted. I paid a price premium for the brand rather than a cheap knock off thinking that it would last longer. Looks like I was wrong
customer_reviews.author: AHF

customer_reviews.title: after 2 years, still the best of my fans
customer_reviews.text: pros: after 2 years , it is still quiet & running cons: none this is so well=built. I have 2 other floor fans & they a much noisier. I have been pricing an upgrade on my old ceiling fan & have realized that I can buy 2 more of these and still have money left over. Living in Florida, it is always a debate between air conditioning vs fan use.....and these fans are the best of the fans....It you are actually intending on using a floor fan....there is nothing else to buy.
customer_reviews.author: OldBill

customer_reviews.title: Not a good value. Expensive features cheap design
customer_reviews.text: Does not use DC motor so a 60hz hum is very noticeable ($5 ac motor) My 1970’s Panasonic pedestal fan was a much better design and quite! This fan is not a good value. Many cool features but as a fan it is lacking. The base is heavy but the fan mount is cheaper then most off brands. The fan blade is also ill balanced a shakes the assembly. To work properly the remote needs a clear sight to the fan - it is weak.
customer_reviews.author: EdistoGrace

customer_reviews.title: buy something like this. If you keep it outside or in ...
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, don't buy those $40 fans at Target that last 4 months and die and vibrate, etc., buy something like this. If you keep it outside or in humidity, I would do a clear coat on the grills to stop them from rusting. I'm using it in my bedroom at night and it's fan-freaking-tastic. The remote is big and bulky, which I don't know if that is good or bad considering the trend of stupidly small remotes. I don't use it though, I walk over and turn on/off when needed.
customer_reviews.author: ac

customer_reviews.title: SUPER QUIET AND SUPER POWERFUL
customer_reviews.text: I personal don't mind a loud and powerful fan at night, it helps me sleep, but my wife cannot handle either. I bought this fan for her, and I am truly impressed. She loves it! It is almost undetectably quiet, yes still blows a soft gentle breeze, but when you want it, it has the power to spare. The design and engineering are both good looking and very sturdy. The footprint is slightly smaller than other fans, so it will fit in a tighter area. I was so impressed I bout a second one for my daughter. I am thinking of buying another. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Scott W. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Quitely disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: If you want an overpriced, very quite fan this is great. To be clear, the fan seems to be well made, has a very easy, very quick, tool-free assembly, and yet almost as quickly disappoints upon the first press of the “Turbo Boost” button. I understand the fan is marketed as “quite” instead of “powerful”, but the description (and countless online reviews) paint a very different picture. I do not have an ability to measure the accuracy of the cfpm claims but I can say that is is at most equivalent if not less than a mid-priced fan bought at a local big-box store.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Rowe

customer_reviews.title: This is a great example of how a quality product is made
customer_reviews.text: I just received this Rowenta fan and assembled it. This is a great example of how a quality product is made. All of the parts fit together beautifully. Nothing was missing. The instructions for assembly are only drawings, not words, but it was clearly shown and easy to follow. It is the quietest fan I have purchased in 30 years. Creates great airflow all around. It is rare that I am this pleased with an electronic item. I strongly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: Assembles easily, runs quiet, provides effective cooling
customer_reviews.text: It does a good job cooling. Just tall enough, works well in a bedroom. Relatively quiet, well-designed. My major complaint is that the remote requires a small watch battery -- CR2032. No battery is supplied with the fan, and there is no marking in the ad or on the box warning you that you need this battery separately, or you can't use the remote. Seems stupid not to include one. Also, there is not place on the fan to store the remote. A small holder would be useful.
customer_reviews.author: Seeker of Handy Tools

customer_reviews.title: Quiet fan but battery for remote isn't included
customer_reviews.text: The fan itself is excellent. I truly can't hear it when it's on the nighttime setting and yet there's enough air movement to make sleeping comfortable. But it's VERY irritating that the remote didn't come with a battery AND the box AND instructions don't say ” batteries not included” so I ended eating a lot of time searching for the battery. For such an expensive fan, couldn't Rowenta have included the battery or at the very least spent the little extra I'll to make it clear the battery isn't included!
customer_reviews.author: Incept

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Fan
customer_reviews.text: This fan is fantastic, it is powerful, quiet, and easy on the eyes. The fan is easy to put together, you practically do not need any tools except a phillips head screwdriver for one screw on the screen. Now I have heard the issues concerning rusting with the fan screen and given that my fan is brand new, I cannot coment on that yet, only time will tell if I have that particular issue. In the mean time, I am giving this fan 4 and a half stars and recommend this fan.
customer_reviews.author: Lamar Childers

customer_reviews.title: Very quite, high quality, solid base....
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 3 of these fans to help circulate air throughout the house in the summer months. Used to use cheaper, lighter weight, big box store fans which made so much noise my wife complained throughout the summer. No more...these are also great in the bedroom at night - super quite. Really can't live comfortably without these - period. Great warranty service as well - one of the front metal screens was slightly damaged in shipping - had a new one sent no questions asked other than receipt confirmation. They are the BMW's of fans!
customer_reviews.author: Little Ricky

customer_reviews.title: Quiet yet powerful.
customer_reviews.text: This fan helped me keep my sanity when the central air conditioning unit for my house gave up the ghost in early July. I could could comfortably sit and watch TV without having to blast the volume. It’s surprising how much air it moves with only a whisper of sound compared to other fans. It’s easy to adjust the height and direction. It can be set to oscillate if desired. The remote is different from a previous version I have in my bedroom and isn’t quite as intuitive. It was so small that it was difficult to locate when unpacking and assembling. Other than that it has been wonderful and worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: S. Haag

customer_reviews.title: The Only Thing Which Can't Be Remotely Controlled...
customer_reviews.text: .. is the rotation. It still operates based on the plastic thing that you pull up or push down at the back of the motor. Other than that, a wonderful fan! My room can get quite hot, but this fan moves the air around so well that it is cooled down to a bearable temperature. For assembly, I figured out that it would be much easier to align the threads for screwing the actual fan assembly together by laying the fan down on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Ben and Becky

customer_reviews.title: Minus star for no remote battery
customer_reviews.text: Nice fan but spending over $130+ for the elite version and the remote requires a custom battery that is not included?? And Its not the kind of battery that most just have lying around the house. Cheaper fans include batteries. Come on Rowenta! Update: Subtracting another star because the oscillation feature is not remote controllable. Seriously, fans half this price have this feature on the remote. I am returning the fan and have purchased one of these other brands. Sorry Rowenta, if you want to charge a premium make a premium product.
customer_reviews.author: Tman717

customer_reviews.title: 2X circulation but 50% less noise!
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal fan. My third such but this new one (same $) is so much better than the older version. Sleep mode, variable speeds, beautiful silver, Thank you!!! BTW, the all metal floor fan sounded like a small airplane & did not tilt so it’s on the porch, not worthy.0
customer_reviews.author: Debora

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what a fan should do
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a fan for a couple of years to keep the Radon risk lower in my office area (until I can install an exhaust fan). Previous fan locked up and fortunately I was there otherwise it might have caused a fire (was very hot when seized up). This fan has a fuse in the power line so I am comfortable that it gives protection against what I experience with the previous other brand fan. Working great, noise level is as expected.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: Very quite and comes with a functional and very cool remote control.
customer_reviews.text: It is quiet. The remote control feature is a plus and its range is over 20 feet. The fan oscillates smoothly and switching speeds is easy on the remote. Also, the remote has a turbo boost feature. This increases the speed and thrust of the fan, yet the fan remains very quiet. The arc outward from the fan is quite wide as well and the height of the fans reach easily cools someone sitting on a high back chair. This is a good fan for the money. Appears well built, attractive, and easily assembled in about ten minutes. I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Yarburger

customer_reviews.title: Won't stay silent long. No replacement parts. Necessary to solve loud volume.
customer_reviews.text: Started making noise after a couple hours of being on. Tried solving it, but now fan is damaged and no replacement parts are available. I have a loud and thus useless fan with absolutely no recourse.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M Silverstein

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the Extra cost
customer_reviews.text: This is without doubt, the BEST fan on the market. It is worth every penny of the higher price. I use it both indoors and outside. The night function is INCREDIBLY quiet. I am a light sleeper and I cannot even hear it at all. The TURBOBOOST and ENERGY SAVING functions are GREAT. The remote is VERU convenient. I bought 2 of them since they work so well. Adfitionally, the appearance is stylish!!
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne Fraser Darling

customer_reviews.title: Quiet Yet Powerful
customer_reviews.text: We own 3 other pedestal fans. All purchased on sale. They work, but have noise connected with operation. We ordered the Rowenta VU5670 Turbo to replace one that stop functioning. Found an independent review that gave this fan high marks. It is expensive, about twice what we had paid for the other on sale fans. It is worth every penny. The sound of the sleep mode is undetectable. The turbo mode moves a lot of air. The remote is great. Easy to operate. Other remotes are note. We have remotes with 2 of our other fans. This one is the best and easiest to use.
customer_reviews.author: FanMan

customer_reviews.title: Cheap fan blades, no instructions, poorly made...very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: The fan came in a box without instructions. Granted not many parts, but without instructions is just bad business. The fan motor had a broken plastic bracket. The fan blade is cheap, flimsy plastic, not worthy of any kind of fan. Once I saw the broken piece, and already disappointed in the quality, I did not even bother starting the fan up. Then, trying to put this thing back into the shipping box took another 20 minutes. What a complete waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: SCOOP

customer_reviews.title: CAN SAVE A MARRIAGE 💯
customer_reviews.text: When I tell you this fan has helped stop many arguments with my husband and I at night, man listen. EVERY night we went to bed my husband had this standup fan that he had to put in his face and it would be so loud that I couldn’t sleep. It’s like my brain wouldn’t shut off it was moving like the fan so I would always turn it off and he couldn’t sleep. I found this fan after “YEARS” of searching for a quiet fan and this thing is simply amazing! Thank you Thank You Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Book Enthusiast

customer_reviews.title: Nice fan
customer_reviews.text: I have had this fan for just under a month. So far so good. It is really quiet. When it is on high you can hear it, but it is far quieter than the other brands of floor fans. I usually have it on low and I can feel the air moving but it is really quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Moyer

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet
customer_reviews.text: It is very quiet, which I love! I had searched for a “quiet fan”. I hope it lasts, as I run at least one 24/7/365. I liked this so much I got one more standing fan and a tabletop fan for the bedrooms. Some people have said the screen can rust, and that the screen is hard to get off, but I live in a dry area, so hopefully that is not a problem, I’m also being more diligent and taking a Swiffer to the screen every day, instead of waiting for buildup and having to taking it apart.
customer_reviews.author: Annie B.

customer_reviews.title: Best Fan Ever - But Does Not Come With Battery for the Remote
customer_reviews.text: This fan is heaven sent!!! It's heavy and solid, quiet as a whisper and circulates the air like no other I've ever bought. I love it!!!! The only downside is there was no battery included with the remote control. I searched everywhere in the packing looking for it only to find the company does not include one. Then I didn't know what size I needed, but finally discovered it's a CR2032. So when you place your order for this fantastic fan order the batteries to go along with it because Amazon's price for them is great.
customer_reviews.author: Estee R. Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: It's gotten so noisy, it's unusable.
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand how this fan has so many good reviews. It worked fine at first but after a few weeks it just got noisier and noisier due to vibrating more and more over time. The lower settings are now way noisier than all but the highest ones because the high speeds cause it to vibrate less. But for what I need it for, the high speeds are completely unnecessary. It's gotten so noisy, it's almost unusable. For its price I feel like I was completely ripped off. I don't know if its defective, I just feel like its cheaply and poorly made for its ridiculous price. I expected so much more from this fan. Think twice before buying!
customer_reviews.author: Nick V

customer_reviews.title: Love this fan
customer_reviews.text: This fan is so quiet compared to all the other fans we have ever had. You can hear the TV over the fan and it is nice to have a quiet fan for sleep. Feels sturdy, works well. We bought one last summer and liked it so much that we bought a second one this summer for a different room. Now no one has to fight over the quiet fan. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy H.

customer_reviews.title: Quietest fan  oh and im buying the little fan bro too
customer_reviews.text: It took me about 3minutes to get everything out. 10-15 minutes to set up. But once it all comes together. Wow. I had the previous version but this one is much nicer. The remote is smaller than the other version and uses that little quater size round battery. Not sure why this version is a few bucks cheaper but hey to be honest. This one is quiter than the other version.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: for the amount this costs - it is not worth it. very cheap with plastic blades that start banging against the metal cage. its extremely heavy and I cant understand why the stand is so wide on bottom. top of the fan is so cheap. please dont buy. i wish i had just done what I have done in past and bought the same size fan for $40 at target.
customer_reviews.author: L.M P

customer_reviews.title: Really nice, quiet fan
customer_reviews.text: Don't give up looking for the remote! Holy cow they hid it good. Check between the folded card board flaps. I was convinced they hadn't sent one. When I found it I couldn't test it b/c no battery, or a least I don't think there's a battery. I like the fan it's nice & quiet. There is a helpful youtube video to put it together in a snap.
customer_reviews.author: Z Baderman

customer_reviews.title: Rusty Review
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this fan for a while now. We live in Florida and use it on our covered patio. It's a very strong fan that moves a lot of air. It has great features and we love it, except for 1 thing. The fan guard or cage that surrounds the moving fan blades, is almost rusted away. Yes, I know what you're thinking but at $150 you would think the metal on the guard would be something that would hold up for 5 or 10 years of outside use. The fan itself has never had any contact with rain so it must just be the humid environment here. Anyway, use a better grade of metal or even consider using plastic.
customer_reviews.author: ronmac

customer_reviews.title: Fan blade broke in under 10 months
customer_reviews.text: This fan’s blade broke in under a year - 10 months to be exact. I do not recommend this fan. Too expensive for how flimsy it is!
customer_reviews.author: SouthAsian Sensation

customer_reviews.title: NEW PURCHASE, BUT OH SO QUIET
customer_reviews.text: I only give it 3 stars for ease of assembly--although it was easy to assemble, I have been unable to get the remote to work. The pictorial directions for syncing the remote sensor on the stand to the remote itself are inexplicable. As for the rest: I've only had this a couple of days but even on the Turbo setting, it's far more quiet than the large-size Vornado fan on its medium setting. And I was able to position the stand near an open window for better air flow. I'll have to return at a later date to discuss durability.
customer_reviews.author: KnitWit

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I returned this fan it was very cheap did not like it. If you're looking for a plastic fan then that's what you want. I needed something more durable so I bought a metal fan from Home Depot best thing in the world.
customer_reviews.author: A. metz

customer_reviews.title: Longevity is an Issue
customer_reviews.text: The fan worked well enough for the first 6 months I got it. I used it every day through the late spring and summer months and made sure to keep the blades and grill clean. After a while, the motor started to make a buzzing sound every now and again. It'll stop if you give it a wobble, but the fan is now far from the consistently silent wonder it was when I first got it.
customer_reviews.author: PenguinHeart

customer_reviews.title: Hands down - the quietest fan for sleeping!
customer_reviews.text: We wanted a quiet fan for use at night when sleeping and this is it. The "Silent Night" mode is truly silent - you can put the fan right next to your bed - all you feel is the cool breeze! It's so quiet that you can sometimes forget to turn it off in the morning. All the turbo modes really move the air yet are not offensively loud. On warmer nights, we can even sleep with it on the lowest of the "turbo" settings. We were so impressed with this fan that we bought another one for our living room. As other reviewers noted, you'll need a CR2032 (button) battery for the remote, oddly, it's not included.
customer_reviews.author: Tea in Irvine

customer_reviews.title: Great fan, quiet mode is nice
customer_reviews.text: I researched a lot of fans before I chose this one. I needed a quiet fan so I can still hear if my younger kids wake up at night. The quiet mode on this fan is great. It’s just the right amount of airflow for sleeping but you can’t even hear it running. The quiet mode only works when the fan is on the lowest setting.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Awesome fan
customer_reviews.text: This is one awesome fan. This is actually the third one purchased for our house. The original is several years old and still going strong. This fan is so quiet that you do not realize it is running. It has a lot of good features too. Some people might consider it a little pricey but it is well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: YankeePooh

customer_reviews.title: Best...fan...ever!...UPDATE re cleanliness
customer_reviews.text: Super quiet. I was concerned paying this much for a fan vs my last $30 fan, but what a difference! Cools better, quieter, and sturdy. Don't expect to move this one around, though, as it's about 25 lbs. A bit of a challenge. Update 4/2017: I still like the fan, but found an issue keeping it clean. I use a handheld vacuum to clean the fan cage just fine, but can't open the cage again to clean the blades once assembled. They've turned black from dust that gets blown around now. Missing my cheaper fan that I could disassemble for cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: citygal

customer_reviews.title: Quietest fan I have heard
customer_reviews.text: This is such a good fan, I ordered a second one. It really is very quiet. The quietest setting only moves a little air but is pretty much silent. The faster speeds can be heard but compared to other fans running at the same speeds, this is a lot quieter. Very helpful for sleeping. I'm hoping it lasts a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey D. Foss

customer_reviews.title: Fundamental assembly directions lacking.
customer_reviews.text: Assembly instructions are very poorly presented as a collection of pictures. There was no battery for the remote control, nor any description of it (number). Thank goodness we still have a Radio Shack in my town! Fan itself is smaller than expected, but has good airflow. I would not buy this fan again.
customer_reviews.author: R. Brown

customer_reviews.title: The quality of the parts is also better and I expect/hope this will last longer than less ...
customer_reviews.text: Worth the money. The previous summer I purchased a cheaper fan that was incredibly noisy. This fan works well and in comparison to the other one, nearly silent. As the fan speed increases, the sound gets louder, but even on the fastest speed (turbo) the noise is very tolerable. The quality of the parts is also better and I expect/hope this will last longer than less expensive fans. There is a blue light that can be quite bright in a dark room, but a small piece of electrical tape can solve that if you find it to be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie S

customer_reviews.title: Good for a year then the face place rusts
customer_reviews.text: This is the best fan I've ever purchased. However, the face plate rusts within a year. No, I don't live in a humid area or near the beach. Rowenta put considerable effort into designing a quiet strong fan. For an extra two bucks, they probably could upgrade to a face plate that doesn't rust. I don't get it.
customer_reviews.author: SunscreenAl

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this fan for about 1 month. it's a well designed/constructed product that was easy to assemble out of the box. It is quiet at low speed and has an ultra low speed setting that one can not hear at all. I like that the buttons are easily readable. the height is adjustable as well as the angle of the fan. great product...I hope it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff

customer_reviews.title: A good machine, but could be even better
customer_reviews.text: Very quiet machine, and excellent. What is bad? The basic upper portion is the same for stand fan and table fan; so, the design is for both. The controls position for the stand fan are awkward-looking, and should have been vertical.
customer_reviews.author: Toufiq Ali

customer_reviews.title: Super quiet, moves a ton of air
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a fan that moves a ton of air and super quiet, this is the one to go with. Easy to assemble. Well packaged. Remote ok, but would rather it had separate buttons for speed up and down. The base is quite heavy and not worried about tipping over. Will fit in with any decor. I did a lot of research before hand, so you wouldn't have to. Great buy. You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Lacy krenn

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, Strong, Well made fan
customer_reviews.text: I use a fan all through the year because I cannot sleep without airflow, and I have burnt out multiple, Honeywell, Vornado, Holmes, Lasko, etc fans. I have become a bit of a fan expert. This fan is worth the money. Its well made, well balanced, and its very quiet. The motor is on the larger side, which you want in a fan as that means it probably wont wear out as fast. The rest of the fan, pedastal, connectons for the blades, etc is just like any 40.00 fan, but the guts are made very well.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan J. Gilman

customer_reviews.title: It's quiet and cools well
customer_reviews.text: I loved this fan. I've had it for 4 years, bought it in 2014. I wanted it for my bedroom which gets very hot So. Cal sun , I needed it to cool the room down and for sleeping at night, so a remote was important. My grill never rusted but it was indoor but by and open window all the time. I need to replace it now as the collar which attaches the grill to the fan motor has cracked off making it totally unusable. Buying another one to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: DebbieG

customer_reviews.title: No Battery for remote. Wobbly base. Quiet.
customer_reviews.text: Not good instructions on assembly but, I figured it out. Took about 15 minutes. Turned in on and it was quiet as advertised. The stand seems too wobbly to me. I feel like it will break easily of I move it too much. I tried the remote and it didn't work. Apparently it needs a battery? Seems like for this much $$$ it should come with a 5 dollar battery. So far, I'm not sure if I'll keep it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this fan
customer_reviews.text: It asks about durability, and since I've only had it for a few weeks, I can't really answer that question yet...however, it does look durable and well made. What I love about this fan is it's so "quiet". OMGosh, I hate noise at night, noisy fans drive me crazy. This fan, on sleep mode, is totally silent. It puts out just a bit of a breeze so when summer comes, I'm sure we will have to kick it up to produce more air, but even at the highest mode, it's pretty darn quiet. Best floor fan I've ever seen!
customer_reviews.author: Linda J. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Like old fashioned appliances
customer_reviews.text: I decided to never again buy cheap products from Amazon, so instead of going for some of the low-end fans, I decided to go for an expensive one with good reviews. I couldn't be more happy. For years I bought fans that were flimsy, all plastic, loud , ugly, etc.... This fan is like the old fashioned appliances that lasted forever. It is sturdy, quiet, nice design. Make yourself a favor and instead of spending $20 every year, buy this one and keep it forever.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: even going outside Amazon and checking for best rated fans
customer_reviews.text: I read many reviews on this fan, even going outside Amazon and checking for best rated fans. This one was rated in the top 5 best fans. I live in Southern rural Georgia, for those of you not from around here, that means "Country", lots of heat and humidity. I have a screened in porch and this fan is perfect. It is quiet on all levels and provides a cool breeze across the porch. I can't say about the rust issue as I have only had it for a short while, but I am glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: ABF

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic junk
customer_reviews.text: Cheap plastic junk wobbles on the floor stand and clicks loudly ... no battery for remote and no assembly instructions ... I feel ripped off by Amazon ... I am returning it for refund
customer_reviews.author: John Donaldson

customer_reviews.title: its awesome no doubts, very much like natural breeze
customer_reviews.text: this fan is awesome, remote, steel grill, quiet, easy to assemble, 3 speeds plus turbo speed really good, heavy duty base so sturdy no wobbling. I was confused after reading some reviews, people complaing about rusting of frame. In instr manual clearly says just use dry cloth to clean the grill. But if u use chemicals spray of course it will rust. For 100 bucks you wants gold plated fan, its doing its job, iam v happy
customer_reviews.author: Abdul

customer_reviews.title: Seven years ownership!!
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these fans for SEVEN years!!! Both run quietly and smooth. I clean them ( which is so easy) during fan season , and when done. Never had a problem with putting them back together after cleaning. If I had to replace them, I would still buy this brand! Worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Cooking queen

customer_reviews.title: Super Fan!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fan two years ago and have to say that it has been a great fan! I broke my knee and definitely needed the remote control!! At the end of summer it is cleaned and stored with a kitchen garbage can over the top . Was a little pricier than others, but worth it. No rust, no breakage!!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. P

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, but not silent
customer_reviews.text: Pretty decent fan that seems to move a lot of air. In the "silent night" mode the fan offers a slight breeze where the fan blades are quiet but the motor has a hum that. you can hear. A bit expensive but decided to keep it as I wasn't interested in testing out other fans.
customer_reviews.author: gugr

customer_reviews.title: Over all, NOT worth $164.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful product and quality, remote control works great, low noise level , easy to assemble, BUTTT, high and Turbo speed is more like MEDIUM speed at its highest speed.I have had it for a couple of months all ready.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Vega

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Parts.
customer_reviews.text: I'm missing the extension post that goes from the base to the control panel. I've looked thru box several times. Could I get a replacement post. 2nd. This is really a DIY item. I mean like you get a box of parts. Even the fan blades are separate.... I'm handy but this is more than I expected. I'm sure the description said that it requires putting together.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: HONEST REPORT FROM THE CASH GUY
customer_reviews.text: First off this was not free, I pay hard earned money out of my pocket just like YOU! I have had this fan for a month and used it constantly every night, First off it is very quiet and very well balanced so it does not disturb my sleep. I am a disabled Vet so for me The fan is a bit heavy to move around . I would buy again and would recommend this fan to friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: vnvace

customer_reviews.title: Great fan but missing the remote control
customer_reviews.text: This fan is super quiet. The only downside is it is missing the remote control. The box was sealed so it looks like the manufacturer didn't get it in the box. I can't find a way to contact Amazon about this nor can I find a way to purchase just the remote. I put it all together before realizing that the remote was missing so don't want to bother with taking it apart and sending back during the pandemic...
customer_reviews.author: Christine Herkenrath

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but doesn't have a battery for remote.
customer_reviews.text: So overall the fan isn't bad. Not too difficult to set up, quiet, lots of features. My complaint is this: It doesn't come with a 20 cent battery for the remote. It's a $123 fan. You couldn't be bothered to toss in a cheap battery so I don't have to go buy one separately to use it?
customer_reviews.author: Nathan1981

customer_reviews.title: Weak, probably less than 400CFM
customer_reviews.text: No way does this thing do 2400 CFM. I have another 700 CFM fan and it moves WAY more air. False advertising. Remote doesn't come with a battery, takes a coin cell battery.
customer_reviews.author: James P Smith

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and fantastic air flow
customer_reviews.text: This fan is so quiet. I bought one for my bedroom 2 years ago so that I didn’t have to blast my tv over fan noise. It’s lasted great and I use it every day. I just bought another one for my living room. It’s sleek looking too. You won’t be disappointed. Easy to assemble. The remote didn’t come with a battery so I have yet to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Point Mom

customer_reviews.title: Rowenta Fan, Oscillating Fan with Remote Control, Standing Fan, 5-Speed, Silver
customer_reviews.text: I like all the features of this fan. It's sturdy, the height is adjustable, the operation is easy and so powerful. It was such an upgrade from the Honeywell that it replaced. I guess the battery didn't come with it, but I know where to find one. The way this fan works, it seems like it'll be around for a while, which is good for me. I won't have to go looking for a new one anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: Eric L. Spinks

customer_reviews.title: Quite function, do not feel that sturdy for the price
customer_reviews.text: Notice level is low, looks good, having a remote is good. It wobles and shakes a bit at the place where the top part sits on base, that does not give a feeling that it's steady, only time will tell how it holds. For the price should have felt steady. There are reviews on the grills getting rusted, will have to wait and see if it happens. Overall a good fan as far as function goes but for built quality will have to see.
customer_reviews.author: GS

customer_reviews.title: Great fan that is worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a replacement for a fan that no longer works. I wanted something on the quiet side to use while I am watching tv at night. I have had this fan for a few weeks now and I can definitely say I am happy with the purchase. I can just barely hear it running on the lowest setting when I am not watching tv. The fan does get progressively louder as the speed setting is increased. The highest speed setting produces a great amount of air flow at a tolerable noise level
customer_reviews.author: x z

customer_reviews.title: Hint: turn the knob clockwise to take it out.
customer_reviews.text: I have tried 3 fans and returned them because of the noise. This Rowlenta is a wonderful machine.I am so happy with it to the point that I purchased another one for my other house. I like it for being so quit, I like the color but its a little pricy. I do not like 2 things: 1) WHY THE REMOTE CONTROL HAS NO BATTERY? AND THE DID NOT EVEN MENTION THE SIZE OF THE BATTERY FOR ME TO BUY! 2) INSTALLATION INSTRUCTION IS NOT CLEAR ANS NOT FRIENDLY! ESPECIALLY THE KNOB. Hint: turn the knob clockwise to take it out ( NOT COUNTERCLOCK WISE) took some time to figure it out and is not written in the instruction sheet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No remote included
customer_reviews.text: It didn't have a remote included in the box. I've been on hold with Amazon for 10 minutes. It took my an hour to assemble and want easy because I'm disabled so returning it will be next to impossible. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

product_meta.title: Rowenta VU5550 Turbo Silence Oscillating Fan, Standing Fan, 4 Speed Fan with Remote Control
product_meta.description: Style:Turbo silence 4 speed fan| Pattern Name:FanIdeal for home or office, the VU5551 Turbo Silence 4-speed oscillating 16-inch pedestal fan is the most powerful and quiet pedestal fan by Rowenta, outperforming leading competitive products both in airflow and silence. Select from three mid-to-high or Turbo Boost speeds for the feeling of an extra-powerful blast of instant fresh air. The speed settings can be quickly adjusted manually or with the remote control. The oscillating five-blade fan head pivots up to 90 degrees in all directions (left, right, up, and down), and can be set to stationary for targeted airflow. Other highlights include adjustable height (42 to 54 inches), a stable base, and a built-in handle for effortless transport from one room to another. Enjoy everyday cooling comfort without giving up valuable peace and quiet with the Rowenta Turbo Silence oscillating pedestal fan.Its important to unplug your fan before carrying out any maintenance work. You can clean the unit with a slightly damp cloth. Never let water into the unit. Use a vacuum cleaner to clean the front grid. Never use abrasive products which might damage the appearance of your appliance.
feature_bullets: POWERFUL AIRFLOW - Delivers exceptionally strong airflow (up to 2436 Cu. Ft./Min.) for immediate sensation of intense fresh air

ULTRA-QUIET OPERATION - 4 extremely silent speeds of airflow (3 mid-to-high or Turbo Boost) for optimum comfort, even at night; noise ranks from 40 to 57 dB, which equals noise levels recorded in a library

OSCILLATING HEAD - 16" oscillating head with 5 uniquely engineered extra-powerful blades; can be set to stationary for targeted airflow; pivots up to 90 degrees in all directions (left, right, up, and down)
CARRY HANDLE & ADJUSTABLE HEIGHT - Built-in handle for effortless transport; adjustable height from 42" to 54"
MANUAL CONTROLS & REMOTE - Manual control dial for easy speed adjustments; remote control included for added convenience

NOTE: Unplug the fan before carrying out any maintenance work. You can clean the unit with a slightly damp cloth. Never let water into the unit. Use a vacuum cleaner to clean the front grid. Never use abrasive products, which might damage the fan's appearance.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars4,063 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
specifications.Warranty Description: 1 year hassle free replacement warranty through rowenta.
specifications.Included Components: Rowenta Vu5551U1 16-Inch 3-Speed Turbo Silence Pedestal Fan, Remote Control
